topicSummary: Hirsutism is the growth of excess terminal hair on the face, chest, linea alba, lower back, buttocks, and anterior thighs in women.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in September 2014 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key RCTs published since the last revision of this topic. No major changes to recommendations have been made. However, the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) warning that the venous thromboembolism risk with Dianette® is likely to be similar to that with Yasmin® has been included in the topic MHRA, 2011. A prescribing information section for eflornithine cream has also been added.
